title: Victoria Beckham cuts a stylish figure in a billowing blouse and satin trousers
text:
She has an eye for design.

So it came as no surprise to see Victoria Beckham was making the most of the eye-catching decor at London Members' Club Annabel's in London on Thursday, even if it did mean spending the day in the toilets.

The former Spice Girl, 45, looked radiant as she posed for a series of new shots and snapped a few selfies on the outing.

Loving life: Victoria Beckham was making the most of the eye-catching decor at Annabel's in London on Thursday, even if it did mean spending the day in the toilets

Victoria proved that wearing all-black doesn't have to be boring as she turned heads in a chic blouse and trouser combination.

The stunning designer donned a billowing satin blouse with ruffles across the bodice and arms that she teamed with flared trousers.

The mother-of-four finished off the look by sweeping her glossy chestnut locks into a low ponytail and opted for a neutral palette of makeup that she could be seen topping up in the images.

Radiant: The mother-of-four swept her glossy chestnut locks into a low ponytail and opted for a neutral palette of makeup that she could be seen topping up in the images.

Snap happy: Victoria proved that wearing all-black doesn't have to be boring as she turned heads in a chic blouse and trouser combination

Victoria's outing came after she was praised by Helen Mirren for being 'kinder' with her eponymous clothing range.

The actress, 74, told Lorraine Kelly on Thursday that she's 'never been able to fit' into any of Victoria's designs until recently, after she delighted the Spice Girl with an appearance at her London Fashion Week show last month.

Helen also joked that she managed to get a 'tiny smile' out of the famously pouted star when they posed together at her catwalk show.

Dressed to impress: The stunning designer donned a billowing satin blouse with ruffles across the bodice and arms that she teamed with flared trousers

She explained: 'I don’t go to a lot of fashion shows. I do love them when I go but I love Victoria as a person.

'She’s just the greatest girl. She’s a lovely, fun, great mum. I got a little tiny smile out of her in that photo of us together. She’s such a darling.

As Lorraine noted that Helen wore a 'lovely snakeskin print dress', Helen added: 'I’ve never been able to fit into them. Now she’s changing and I think she’s being a little kinder. I’ve been a big admirer of her clothes.'
